result.execSummary:
The defendant Ladell A Evans was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:02 AM Attorney Peggy A. Crooks-Mishacoff in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Melville Peter Middleton II in court for Ladell A Evans. Defendant Ladell A Evans in court, in custody. Waiver to right of preliminary hearing rights.  Court found defendant waived right to preliminary hearing and found probable cause and bound over for further proceedings.  Information filed.  Reading waived.  Defendant wanted to go forward today with plea and sentencing.  Rights/elements.  Defendant plead no contest  and court accepted plea, adjudged guilty .  Court imposed 30 months prison:  18 month initial confinement, 12 months extend supervision.  $518.00 costs.  Submit DNA sample.  No jail credit.  Court did not order psych evaluation and leaving that up to Dept of Corrections. Eligible for Challenge/not Eligible for Substance Abuse.  No jail credit.
Plaintiffs Motion and Demand for Discovery and Notice of DNA and Witness List filed by Atty Crooks-Mishacoff

2:03 PM Prosecuting attorney Jordan Lippert appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Ladell A Evans appeared by video in custody from Green Bay Correctional Institution without counsel. Waived reading. Right to atty. Defendant stated he does not want counsel/request to enter a guilty plea. Court ordered a $10,000.00 signature bond w/standard felony conditions. Time limits waived. Statement by Atty Lippert, request to set for prelim waiver & plea/sentencing on same date. Plea/sentencing & prelim waiver scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
